impossible_scenarios.message: TCP cannot use MAC addresses - they operate at different layers
Routers use IP addresses for routing, not MAC addresses
IP cannot work without the network layer

ambiguous_questions.message: Question too broad - please specify which aspect you want to know about
ambiguous_questions.suggestion: Try: 'Explain TCP connection establishment' or 'What is TCP flow control?'

non_academic_tone.message: Please use academic language for technical questions

out_of_syllabus.message: Question is outside Computer Networks syllabus
out_of_syllabus.suggestion: Focus on networking protocols, layers, or network architecture

unit1.title: Introduction to Computer Networks
unit1.description: Basic concepts of computer networks, protocols, OSI model, TCP/IP architecture, and data communication fundamentals

unit2.title: Physical and Data Link Layer
unit2.description: Physical layer transmission, data link layer protocols, Ethernet, frame structure, error detection and flow control mechanisms

unit3.title: Network Layer
unit3.description: Network layer protocols, IP addressing, routing algorithms, subnetting, NAT, DHCP, and ICMP protocols

unit4.title: Transport Layer
unit4.description: Transport layer services, TCP and UDP protocols, socket programming, port numbers, and congestion control

unit5.title: Application Layer
unit5.description: Application layer protocols including HTTP, DNS, FTP, SMTP, SNMP and web services

misconceptions.message: HTTP operates at application layer, not transport layer
misconceptions.suggestion: Try asking about HTTP at the application layer or TCP at the transport layer

misconceptions.message: TCP operates at transport layer, not application layer
misconceptions.suggestion: Consider asking about TCP's transport layer functions or application layer protocols like HTTP

misconceptions.message: IP operates at network layer, not transport layer
misconceptions.suggestion: Ask about IP routing at network layer or TCP/UDP at transport layer

misconceptions.message: Ethernet operates at data link layer, not network layer
misconceptions.suggestion: Focus on Ethernet frames at data link layer or IP at network layer

cross_layer_errors.message: TCP operates at transport layer and doesn't handle MAC addresses (data link layer)
cross_layer_errors.suggestion: Ask about TCP port numbers or Ethernet MAC addresses separately

cross_layer_errors.message: HTTP operates at application layer and doesn't handle MAC addresses (data link layer)
cross_layer_errors.suggestion: Consider HTTP methods/headers or Ethernet addressing as separate topics

cross_layer_errors.message: IP addresses and MAC addresses serve different purposes at different layers
cross_layer_errors.suggestion: Ask about IP addressing or MAC addressing as distinct concepts
